title: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant Has Power Restored, Watchdog Says
description: Maintaining power at Europe’s largest nuclear plant has been crucial to prevent a meltdown in the shadow of fighting nearby.

title: Nancy Pelosi visits Armenia after outbreak of deadly fighting with Azerbaijan.
Mass Graves in Izium Renew Focus on Holding Russia Accountable
description: The U.N. General Assembly voted to allow Ukraine’s president to address the gathering of world leaders with a recorded message next week.

title: Nancy Pelosi Visits Armenia Amid Conflict With Azerbaijan
description: The House speaker, who has previously inserted herself at the center of global conflicts, is the highest-ranking American official to visit Armenia since it gained independence 30 years ago.

title: Prince William and Prince Harry Stood Vigil Over the Queen at Westminster Hall
description: Prince William and Prince Harry stood vigil over their grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, at Westminster Hall as mourners streamed in to pay their respects.

title: Russia continues attacking in Ukraine’s east despite recent setbacks.
From L.A. to Rome, Ancient Sculptures Get Hero’s Welcome
description: Three statues were returned to Italy after the J. Paul Getty Museum discovered they had been looted. They will be displayed temporarily in Rome before heading to Taranto, Italy, their permanent home.

title: Biden Meets With Relatives of Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan
description: The president is trying to negotiate the release of the two Americans imprisoned in Russia amid poisoned relations over the war in Ukraine.

title: What’s Behind the Success of the Far-Right Sweden Democrats?
description: Campaigning on issues like immigration, religion, crime and the cost of environmental rules, the Sweden Democrats, a party with neo-Nazi roots, grew its support.

title: What Does Queen Elizabeth’s Death Mean for Canada?
description: The accession of King Charles III may inspire more discussion about the relevance of the monarchy in Canada, but materially, experts say it’s business as usual.

title: Baking Challah
description: Summer’s rituals are giving way to fall’s, but for the moment, you can enjoy them all.

title: Japan Warns ‘Violent Typhoon’ Nanmadol Could Hit on Sunday
description: Several areas were under evacuation orders for the storm, called Nanmadol, that was expected to carry gales and heavy rain and trace nearly the entire length of the country.

title: Biden Warns Putin Against Use of Unconventional Weapons as Russia Suffers Losses
description: President Biden told the CBS News program “60 Minutes” that the U.S. response would be “consequential.”

title: The U.S. Vowed to Defend Central American Democracy. Autocrats Had Other Plans.
description: The Biden administration’s plan to stem migration by building the rule of law in Central America has thus far failed to stop authoritarians or persuade people to stay.

title: Lip-Reading and Fashion Criticism: Meghan’s U.K. Trip Under Scrutiny
description: The actions of Meghan, and her husband, Prince Harry, as they mourn the queen have been the subject of biting social commentary — as usual.

title: Russia and Ukraine trade blows in the south.
An eastern city under attack wonders how far Ukraine’s offensive can go.
Ukraine’s Donbas, Where Putin Sowed the Seeds of War
description: In one small town in the Donbas region, everything suddenly fell apart. It was part of Vladimir Putin’s grand plan, and it helped lay the groundwork for the invasion of Ukraine. Now things are heating up again.

title: After 75 Years, Cheetahs Return to India in a Grand Experiment
description: Scientists aim to determine whether a predator population can be restored in a place where it was hunted into extinction.

title: Woman’s Death in Iran After Arrest by the Morality Police Triggers Outrage
description: Masha Amini was detained for allegedly violating dress rules. Her suspicious death, publicized by social media, has led to protests and condemnations by prominent Iranians.
